sentences.english: Can you come down a little? --Sorry, its one price for all.
sentences.chinese: 你能便宜一点卖吗？对不起，不二价。

sentences.english: Can you come down a little? --Sorry, it's one price for all.
sentences.chinese: 你能自制一点卖吗？对不起，不二价。

sentences.english: I'm afraid not, sir. The prices are fixed.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能，先生，我们是不二价的。

sentences.english: Sorry , it is uniform price without negotiation .
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我们是统一售价，不二价。

sentences.english: We hold a one-price policy. it's against our regulations to give you a discount .
sentences.chinese: 我们执行不二价的政策，给予折扣有违公司规定。

definition: to make a counteroffer when haggling/to bargain
cheating neither old nor young (idiom); treating youngsters and old folk equally scrupulously/Our house offers sincere treatment to all and fair trade to old and young alike.
to quote a price/seller's first offer
asking price/to ask a price/to demand terms (in negotiations)
to beat down the price/to haggle/to slash one's prices
to offer credit/credit transaction/to buy or sell on account
to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
to bargain/to haggle with a peddler
